results.title: Budgeting your money
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
This film shows four young people in different financial situations discussing their budgeting problems in conversations which lead to information on how budgets are made and carried out. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Budgeting (NP)
results.brief_description: Shows the essentials of business budgeting, explains how to construct a budget and why it is such an important management tool. Provides clear and colourful graphics with animated sequences. Features John Cleese. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Budget cuts
results.brief_description: Produced by Oxo, in association with the National Federation of Meat Traders Association, this is a demonstration of cooking, and the attractive arrangement of low-cost dishes. A butcher explains and shows various cuts of meat; emphasizes the value of cheaper cuts and how they can be used to advantage. No other credits available.

results.title: Buddhism: The Path to Enlightenment
results.brief_description: Traces the life of the Buddha from his birth as a prince through time spent as a wandering mendicant in search of a solution for life’s sorrow to his later years when he trudged the dusty paths of India preaching his ego-shattering life-redeeming message. That message is threaded throughout the film as we visit monasteries and families in two different craft communities and see how Buddhism has influenced the lives of these gentle people in southeast Asia.

results.title: Buddhism: the middle way of compassion
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Religions of the world”.
A compassionate view of life, Buddhism has had a profound influence on the philosophical and political development of the nations of Asia. People in the West are becoming increasingly attracted to Buddhism and there are over 250 million followers. This episode looks at the life of the Buddha and at different types of Buddhist beliefs.

results.title: Buddhism in China
results.brief_description: The rise of Buddhism in China is traced from its beginning in 4 BC. The film gives a good outline of Buddha’s philosophy and teaching, the further changes and the new sects. The film is narrated by Alexander Scourby.

results.title: Buddha wish me luck
results.creator_credit: SBS-TV, Sally Ingleton and Margaret Smith
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Erwin, a refugee from Hungary and his wife Samran, whom he met on a trip to Thailand live near Darwin. They describe their separate experiences as immigrants to Australia, their life together and the small tropical fruit farm that they own. Erwin is a loner, who likes nothing better than to go off hunting crocodiles, or fishing, but his wife Samran enjoys the human contact and busyness of the market where she sells her fruit. A tantalising glimpse into a marriage between two quite different people.

results.title: Bud and Lou
results.creator_credit: Bob Balaban, Robert C Thompson and Clyde B Phillips
results.brief_description: This is a biographical made for television feature length film based on the book “Bud & Lou” by Bob Thomas which attempts to portray both the personal and professional lives of the comedic partnership of Bud Abbott and Lou Costello. It follows their career from the Burlesque days, through to broadway, radio, Hollywood and eventually television, entertaining millions along the way. They were renowned for their generosity to charitable causes and were heavily involved with the War Bond drives during WWII but each had their own personal demons to deal with including Lou’s problem with gambling and Bud’s problems with drinking and epilepsy. Harvey Korman stars as Bud Abbott, Buddy Hackett as Lou Costello, and Arte Johnson plays their loyal agent Eddie Sherman. Cast also includes Michele Lee (as Lou’s wife), Robert Reed, Donald Hotton, Harry Solin.

results.title: Buckstop
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Rhian Hinkley
results.brief_description: Five minutes of animation through the use of 3,000 still photographs serves as a homage to the spaghetti Western, as Buck rides into town looking for a bit of action and a parking space.
